      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JBlasMatrix create(kotlin.ranges.IntRange data)
      Creates a row-vector with initial values pulled from an int range, e.g. 1..45
      JBlasMatrix create(double[] data)
      Creates a row-vector with initial values pulled from an double array
      JBlasMatrix create(double[] data)
      Creates a matrix from an array of arrays (row-major)
      JBlasMatrix eye(int size)
      Creates an identity matrix of the requested shape
      JBlasMatrix eye(int rows, int cols)
      Creates an identity matrix of the requested shape, with zero padding if the axis lengths arent equal.
      JBlasMatrix ones(int size)
      Creates a one initialized square matrix of the requested shape
      JBlasMatrix ones(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a one initialized matrix of the requested shape
      JBlasMatrix rand(int size)
      Creates a vector of size many uniform 0-1 random samples
      JBlasMatrix rand(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a matrix of uniform 0-1 random samples
      JBlasMatrix rand(int rows, int cols, long seed)
      Creates a matrix of rows x cols uniform 0-1 samples using the given seed. Two calls with the same seed will produce identical matrices
      JBlasMatrix randn(int size)
      Creates a vector of size many unit-normal random samples
      JBlasMatrix randn(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a matrix of unit-normal random samples
      JBlasMatrix randn(int rows, int cols, long seed)
      Creates a matrix of rows x cols random samples using the given seed. Two calls with the same seed will produce identical matrices
      JBlasMatrix zeros(int rows, int cols)
      Generate a zero initialized matrix of the requested shape.
      JBlasMatrix zeros(int size)
      Generate a zero initialized square matrix of the requested shape.
